body:
> Adding an additional HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN_NO_CASK envvar boolean indicating the flow its use is adjusting and follows other "opt out" flags in the environment variables.

I wonder if this is even needed; I'm not sure anyone is successfully using `HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN` with casks?

Thoughts?

I know I would like to use `HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN` to steer folks from sourcing everything over the Internet and the user access proxies by leveraging a cache. The change is because if you use bottles and casks at the same time you may have poor results during install/update when that is set to something other than a forward proxy.  JFrog's expectations was that the functionality just worked, but they didn't actually test it against Casks. While they can handle mirroring the GitHub Packages source they can't handle the arbitrary sourcing needed for Cask support which is why they added the comments to their KB noting the conflict.

Originally I had poked at `HOMEBREW_BOTTLE_DOMAIN` to try and scope it only to bottles but it seems to try the tar.gz structure instead of the blob/sha256 we would have in the OCI registry mirror as noted in #11781.

And if anyone has a method to allow for steering brew to a Packages mirror for bottles and falling back to standard proxy environment variables for casks I am game.  The current workaround for folks is to do their install upgrade using the mirror and then unset `HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN` so that the casks that fail downloading will successfully download.

And @MikeMcQuaid I was making the assumption that folks were using that existing model and was thinking of do no harm.  Now I am curious on the perimeter solution that works in that way (reverse proxy/webapp), but that's just my experience w proxy environments.  And also it is based off the docs as well where any URL gets a prefix which given for ghcr.io you actually will replace and not prefix.

Now if `HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN` should only be replaced on matches for the GitHub Packages endpoint I am wondering if there is a bug in the regex.  Now I have not spent a ton of time on ruby code so I may be reading this wrong.  

Currently the url.sub(...) call that is used into when artifact_domain uses a regex with a submatch on Packages:URL which means it also matches "https" as well and will replace that with the content of artifact_domain.  If you remove that submatch on Packages (which I think was intended) than the URL substitution will only happen for ghcr.io endpoints and ignore any others (e.g. Casks).

Example
```
url1 = "https://ghcr.io/v2/homebrew/core/gnu-getopt/manifests/2.38"
url2 = "https://corretto.aws/downloads/resources/11.0.15.9.1/amazon-corretto-11.0.15.9.1-macosx-x64.pkg"
artifact_domain = "https://pkgregistry.com/Homebrew"
gpregex1 = %r{^(https?://ghcr.io/)?}o
gpregex2 = %r{^https?://ghcr.io/?}o
replaced = "#{artifact_domain.chomp("/")}/"

puts url1.sub(gpregex1,replaced)
puts url2.sub(gpregex1,replaced)
puts url1.sub(gpregex2,replaced)
puts url2.sub(gpregex2,replaced)

#Which results in 
https://pkgregistry.com/Homebrew/v2/homebrew/core/gnu-getopt/manifests/2.38
https://pkgregistry.com/Homebrew/https://corretto.aws/downloads/resources/11.0.15.9.1/amazon-corretto-11.0.15.9.1-macosx-x64.pkg
https://pkgregistry.com/Homebrew/v2/homebrew/core/gnu-getopt/manifests/2.38
https://corretto.aws/downloads/resources/11.0.15.9.1/amazon-corretto-11.0.15.9.1-macosx-x64.pkg
```

And I did manually patch my local installed copy and bottles coming from our package registry and following the proxy envvars out to the Internet for the casks.

So happy to open the PR for the description in env_config and the removal of the sub-match in download_strategy if you think this was the intent of  https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pull/11766 and the regex match just got by the tests.

> And @MikeMcQuaid I was making the assumption that folks were using that existing model and was thinking of do no harm.

We can revert if necessary and people complain. I don't see a lot of evidence that any proxy supports casks in the way this variable requires.



> So happy to open the PR for the description in env_config and the removal of the sub-match in download_strategy if you think this was the intent of #11766 and the regex match just got by the tests.

Happy to review, not sure I can comment sufficiently without seeing some code. Feel free to not e.g. fix style or tests first if it makes that quicker/easier in case it gets rejected.

We have a few internal corporate hurdles and I am in the queue, but I am hoping that the removal of a couple parens (and change to env_config for the docs) will cruise through the gates w/o too much back and forth.  Fortunately no CLA on this one which gets extra fun.

issue.title: change cURL download behaviour for HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN.

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

repository.name: brew
repository.description: üç∫ The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

issue.body:
instead of prefixing and/or replacing data in URLs, the
*HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN* environment variable only replaces
the bottle base URL. this causes URLs from Casks and other assets
to be no longer affected by this feature.

closes #13226
closes #13222
obsoletes #13227

issue.title: Remove bad submatch and update docs

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

repository.name: brew
repository.description: üç∫ The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

issue.body:
- [x] Have you followed the guidelines in our [Contributing](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md) document?
- [x] Have you checked to ensure there aren't other open [Pull Requests](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/pulls) for the same change?
- [x] Have you added an explanation of what your changes do and why you'd like us to include them?
- [ ] Have you written new tests for your changes? [Here's an example](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew/blob/HEAD/Library/Homebrew/test/PATH_spec.rb).

- [ ] Have you successfully run `brew typecheck` with your changes locally?
- [ ] Have you successfully run `brew tests` with your changes locally?

-----

Related to #13226 where the Cask download URL was being modified when using HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN.  Small change to regex in the GitHubPackages::URL_DOMAIN where an extra set of parens created a match on https and not just on the content of the URL_DOMAIN const.  This resulted in prefixing of Cask download URLs in a fashion that was unlikely to be supported on most proxies and couldn't be supported on Package mirrors (e.g JFrog Artifactory).  This adjusts the regex to remove the extra submatch so that use of the HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN envvar will only replace the content of the const and not match the "https" token.

issue.title: decouple authentication information from HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

repository.name: brew
repository.description: üç∫ The missing package manager for macOS (or Linux)

issue.body:
add support for credentials usage in combination with other mirroring
features. previously `HOMEBREW_DOCKER_REGISTRY_TOKEN` and
`HOMEBREW_DOCKER_REGISTRY_BASIC_AUTH_TOKEN` where only used in combination
with `HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN` which affects *all* curl download strategies.
`HOMEBREW_BOTTLE_DOMAIN` is only used for bottle artifacts, whose mirror might
also require credentials.
this change removes the requirement of using `HOMEBREW_ARTIFACT_DOMAIN`.

related to #13226
